entries.title: Newspaper headlines: 'Fears for sick' and PM's 'silence' over strike
entries.description: The impact of NHS strikes dominates the front pages of Thursday's newspapers.

entries.title: Iran protesters 'too scared to go to hospital'
entries.description: Many of those injured in the demonstrations avoid going to hospital for fear of being arrested.

entries.title: Watch: Sportscene - Celtic v Livingston highlights
entries.description: Watch highlights of Wednesday's Scottish Premiership match between Celtic and Livingston on BBC Scotland's Sportscene.

entries.title: In pictures: Zelensky's momentous day in Washington
entries.description: The Ukrainian president takes his first foreign trip since Russia invaded his country in February.

entries.title: The people who rent the same Christmas tree year after year
entries.description: Some people are choosing to hire their Christmas tree to try to reduce waste and help the environment.

entries.title: Christmas beetles: Scientists ask Australians for help finding missing festive bugs
entries.description: Seen as a symbol of Christmas in Australia, the beetles seem to have gone missing in recent years.

entries.title: Battle of the Brits 2022: Andy Murray beats Jack Draper after Dan Evans wins opener
entries.description: Andy Murray whips up the home crowd with a stirring victory over Jack Draper to leave Battle of the Brits level at 1-1 after day one.

entries.title: Firms 'banging heads against wall' over post-Brexit trade
entries.description: Two years after post-Brexit trading began with the EU, UK businesses feel frustrated, says BCC.

entries.title: Manchester United 2-0 Burnley: Christian Eriksen and Marcus Rashford score in EFL Cup
entries.description: Christian Eriksen and Marcus Rashford score as Manchester United see off Burnley at Old Trafford in the Carabao Cup fourth round.

entries.title: Fleeing China's Covid lockdowns for the US - through a Central American jungle
entries.description: Fed up with lockdowns and Xi's policies, some Chinese citizens are taking a perilous journey to escape.

entries.title: China Covid: 'Everyone I know is getting a fever'
entries.description: The lifting of restrictions has been followed by nationwide outbreaks - and online anger.

entries.title: Coronavirus: China's hospitals seem to be filling up - WHO
entries.description: China's figures say no-one died of Covid on Wednesday - but there is scepticism about the data.

entries.title: Celtic 2-1 Livingston: League leaders restore nine-point lead at summit
entries.description: Celtic restore their nine-point lead at the summit of the Scottish Premiership after victory over stubborn Livingston.

entries.title: Pele: Brazil great's cancer getting worse, says hospital
entries.description: Brazil great Pele's cancer is getting worse, according to the hospital where the 82-year-old is being treated.

entries.title: Beth Mead wins Sports Personality of the Year
entries.description: England and Arsenal footballer Beth Mead is crowned BBC Sports Personality of the Year 2022, ahead of Ben Stokes and Eve Muirhead.

entries.title: Sports Personality of the Year 2022: England's Lionesses and Sarina Wiegman win team and coach of the year
entries.description: England's Lionesses are named BBC Sports Personality Team of the Year 2022 while Sarina Wiegman wins Coach of the Year.

entries.title: Vote on Scottish gender reforms to be delayed
entries.description: The final vote on the controversial proposals will now not be held until Thursday.

entries.title: Sports Personality of the Year 2022: Rob Burrow honoured with Helen Rollason Award
entries.description: Rugby league legend Rob Burrow is honoured with the Helen Rollason Award at Sports Personality of the Year, as former team-mate Kevin Sinfield receives special recognition.

entries.title: Zurich 1-9 Arsenal: Crushing win gives Gunners top spot in Champions League group
entries.description: Arsenal clinch top spot in Group C of the Women's Champions League as Frida Maanum scores a hat-trick in a 9-1 win at bottom side Zurich.

entries.title: Young Sports Personality of the Year 2022: Gymnast Jessica Gadirova wins award
entries.description: Britain's teenage world champion gymnast Jessica Gadirova is named BBC Young Sports Personality of the Year.

entries.title: Ryan Reynolds and Rob McElhenney get freedom of Wrexham
entries.description: Wrexham AFC's Hollywood owners are honoured for promoting the city and the club's history.

entries.title: Ambulance strike: Warning of very challenging days ahead
entries.description: Thousands of paramedics, call handlers and technicians are taking action in England and Wales until midnight.

entries.title: Premier League: VAR has made six incorrect interventions this season
entries.description: Premier League video assistant referees (VAR) have made six incorrect interventions this season.

entries.title: Ex-FTX boss agrees to be extradited to US
entries.description: Sam Bankman-Fried has agreed to be taken from the Bahamas to the US to face fraud charges.

entries.title: Who is striking? How Thursday 22 December’s walkouts will affect you
entries.description: What you need to know about Thursday's walkout by highway workers, by the BBC's Zoe Conway.

entries.title: Fresh warning of disruption on airport strike days
entries.description: A senior Border Force official has said he hopes to keep all airports open as staff strike.

entries.title: NFL: Franco Harris, who made 'Immaculate Reception', dies aged 72
entries.description: Former Pittsburgh Steelers running back Franco Harris, who made the 'Immaculate Reception' in 1972, dies at the age of 72.

entries.title: Body found in undercarriage of Gatwick plane
entries.description: The plane had flown from the Gambia to the West Sussex airport on 7 December.

entries.title: Glaswegian who 'invented' chicken tikka masala dies
entries.description: Glasgow chef Ahmed Aslam Ali is said to have first come up with the dish in the 1970s.

entries.title: Ukraine war: Russia not to blame for conflict - Putin
entries.description: President Vladimir Putin claims he still continues to see Ukraine as a brotherly nation.

entries.title: Pep Guardiola: Manchester City boss needs Champions League win to complete time at club
entries.description: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola says his time at the club will 'not be complete' if the Blues fail to win the Champions League.

entries.title: Beth Mead & Vivianne Miedema: Why are so many women footballers suffering ACL injuries?
entries.description: With Beth Mead and Vivianne Miedema the latest female players to suffer ACL injuries, BBC Sport takes a look at the issue.

entries.title: Shaunagh Brown discusses her retirement from rugby in her BBC Sport column
entries.description: England prop Shaunagh Brown explains why she is retiring from rugby and explores what might come next in her BBC Sport column.

entries.title: England prop Shaunagh Brown calls time on rugby career
entries.description: England prop Shaunagh Brown will retire from rugby at the end of December after winning 30 caps and four Six Nations titles.

entries.title: Flawed EU settlement scheme could create illegal migrants says High Court
entries.description: Home Office rules affecting millions of EU citizens in the UK after Brexit are unlawful, a judge rules.

entries.title: Russia's Natalya Antyukh stripped of London 2012 gold
entries.description: Russia's Natalya Antyukh is stripped of 400m hurdles gold from London 2012 on the basis of historical data from a Moscow testing laboratory.

entries.title: Disused cruise ships could be used to house asylum seekers - Braverman
entries.description: The home secretary told a committee of peers that using hotels was costing more than £5m a day.

entries.title: Boris Becker feared attack in UK jail but learned lesson
entries.description: The former tennis champion describes almost eight months in two British jails.

entries.title: Netflix password sharing may be illegal, says UK government
entries.description: The Intellectual Property Office said the practice might break criminal and civil law.

entries.title: Joe Lycett defends himself after Qatar hypocrisy charge
entries.description: The comedian criticised David Beckham's links with Qatar but has previously played gigs there himself.

entries.title: World Cup 2022: How Argentina's chaotic celebrations unfolded
entries.description: An estimated five million fans turned out on the streets of Buenos Aires to welcome home Argentina's World Cup heroes.

entries.title: Man Utd trigger contract extensions for Diogo Dalot, Luke Shaw, Marcus Rashford & Fred
entries.description: Manchester United trigger one-year contract extensions for a quartet of first-team players, including England's Marcus Rashford.

entries.title: Chelsea appoint Vivell, who helped unearth Haaland
entries.description: Chelsea have appointed Christopher Vivell, formerly of German side RB Leipzig, as the club's new technical director.

entries.title: Afghanistan: Tears and protests as Taliban shut universities to women
entries.description: As the Taliban shut universities and other education centres, Afghan women see their future crumble.

entries.title: Nurses in Scotland reject latest pay offer from NHS
entries.description: Members of the Royal College of Nursing are planning strike action after voting down a pay deal.

entries.title: Olivia Pratt-Korbel: Liverpool man denies nine-year-old girl's murder
entries.description: Thomas Cashman, 34, pleads not guilty to the murder of the nine-year-old in her home in Liverpool.

entries.title: Killamarsh deaths: Damien Bendall admits rape and four murders
entries.description: Damien Bendall carried out "brutal, vicious and cruel attacks" on his defenceless victims.

entries.title: Baby pink iguanas spotted for first time in Galapagos Islands
entries.description: There are only thought to be a few hundred of the critically endangered species left in the world.

entries.title: H&M: Justin Bieber collection axed after singer's 'trash' criticism
entries.description: The retailer removed its collection after the star says he didn't approve it or give permission.

entries.title: Ambulance strike: Union fury over minister Steve Barclay's claims
entries.description: Ambulance workers in England and Wales walk out amid a bitter war of words with the government.

entries.title: Toronto: Eight teenage girls charged with killing man
entries.description: The teenagers are accused of attacking a 59-year-old man in Toronto in what police called "a swarming".

entries.title: Most expensive streets in England and Wales revealed
entries.description: All 10 of the most expensive streets in England are in south and west London, according to Halifax.

entries.title: Dropbox co-founder shares secret for sorting emails
entries.description: Drew Houston, co-founder and CEO of data-sharing platform Dropbox, shares his business advice for the CEO Secrets series.

entries.title: Terry Hall was diagnosed with cancer before his death, his bandmate reveals
entries.description: The Specials star had pancreatic cancer which spread to his liver, says bassist Horace Panter.

entries.title: Phoenix Suns & Phoenix Mercury set for record $4bn sale
entries.description: Billionaire Mat Ishbia is closing in on a deal to buy a controlling stake in the Phoenix Suns and Mercury in an agreement that will value the franchises at a record $4bn (£3.3bn).

entries.title: Government borrowing in November highest on record
entries.description: Official figures show the government spent £22bn more than it raised - the highest ever figure for the month.

entries.title: Terminally ill boy, 11, enjoys video call with Johnny Depp
entries.description: The star reprised the role of Captain Jack Sparrow for Kori, a huge Pirates of the Caribbean fan.

entries.title: Strictly Come Dancing star Amy Dowden hurt by body shaming
entries.description: Strictly Come Dancing's Amy Dowden on how people commenting on her Crohn's flare-ups can affect her.

entries.title: Eddie Jones: Former England coach wants another international job
entries.description: Eddie Jones says he wants to continue coaching at international level and has not ruled out the possibility of taking the Australia job.

entries.title: Olly Stephens: Concerns about killer's violent nature raised before killing
entries.description: Worries about a teenager's violent nature were repeatedly raised before he murdered 13-year-old Olly Stephens.

entries.title: BBC Cymru Wales Sports Personality of the Year 2022: Para-athlete Olivia Breen gets award
entries.description: Para-athlete Olivia Breen is named BBC Cymru Wales Sports Personality of the Year for 2022.

entries.title: Elon Musk to quit as Twitter CEO when replacement found
entries.description: Elon Musk says he will resign as soon as he finds someone "foolish enough" to take over the job.

entries.title: Brixton Academy: Tributes to security worker killed in Asake gig crush
entries.description: Relatives pay tribute to security contractor Gaby Hutchinson who died in a crush at Brixton O2 Academy.

entries.title: Clarkson's Meghan comments 'awful' but host will remain, says ITV boss
entries.description: ITV boss Kevin Lygo says Jeremy Clarkson's comments in The Sun do not represent the channel's values.

entries.title: Enough fentanyl to kill every single American seized in 2022
entries.description: Nearly 400m potentially fatal doses - double last year's total - were intercepted by federal agents.

entries.title: People aged 16 and 17 in Scotland to be allowed to change gender
entries.description: A marathon debate on controversial gender reforms ends for the night after the lights go out in the Holyrood chamber.

entries.title: Migrants detained illegally, official email claims
entries.description: Hundreds of people were sent to immigration removal centres after Manston exceeded capacity, emails show.

entries.title: African, Arab or Amazigh? Morocco's identity crisis
entries.description: How football ignited a debate over whether Moroccans are Africans, Arabs or Amazigh - or all three.

entries.title: 'I was homeless - now dozens join my Christmas hikes'
entries.description: Damon Alexander-Cole became homeless in 2020 and found that walking helped him to rebuild his life.

entries.title: US pastor robbed on livestream faces fraud and extortion charges
entries.description: Lamor Whitehead was robbed of more than $1m in jewellery during a livestreamed sermon in July.

entries.title: Cost of living: If no one comes we close early, says pub
entries.description: Almost 90% of pubs are considering shorter opening hours over winter as bills rise, according to a new survey.
